intro: Grammadenia panamensis, commonly known as the Panama grammadenia, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Panama. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, intricate floral structure. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its flowers are small but striking, often displaying vivid colors that attract specific pollinators. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
